sight from Nido de Condores
THE STONE CENTINEL...
In this slopes, where the ice
and the wind are supreme, the
extremes are used to touching
themselves, the beginning
and the end of a road,
success and failure,
life and death.

                           By  A.RANDIS
MYTHICAL MASS OF ALMOST 7,000 METERS
which rises its summit to the stars, while its shadow casts from the desert to the ocean. Scenery of unusual stories, of great gestures of courage and heroism.

"THIS IS ACONCAGUA, THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN
IN THE AMERICAN CONTINENT"

COME WITH US IN THIS UNFORGETABLE ADVENTURE…
 
LOCATION
Aconcagua Provincial Park   		The origin of its name has several interpretations:
Aconcagua -6,962 meters, is the highest mountain of the American Continent, it belongs to the “Seven Summit” circuit.
It is located in Argentina Republic, in the province of Mendoza, department of Las Heras.
It bounds with “Los Horcones” lower valley to the west and south-west and with “Las Vacas” valley to the east and north. The hills “Cuerno” (5,450mts), “Catedral” (5,200mts), “Bonete”(5,100mts) and “De los Dedos”(5,000mts) are in “Los Horcones” upper valley. We find the hills “Mirador”(5,800mts), “Ibañez”(5,200mts), “Almacenes”(4,800mts) in “Los Horcones” lower valley. The hills “Ameghino”(5,800mts), “Fitz Gerald”(5,300mts), “Santa María”(5,100mts) and all the hills which form “Los Penitentes” chain belong to “Las Vacas” valley.
  
 

For Quechua population it means "The white centinel", in Aymará language "The stone centinel".
